alert.note: Alert for Erie; Niagara (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 6:52PM EST until February 26 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York... Tonawanda Creek At Rapids affecting Erie and Niagara Counties. .Rain and snowmelt led to rising levels on creeks and rivers. Flows in rivers will increase and reach critical levels. For the Tonawanda Creek...including Rapids...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tonawanda Creek At Rapids. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon to Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flood stage, lowland flooding of farm areas along Tonawanda Creek between Rapids and the Tonawanda Indian Reservation. Flooding may impact Fletcher, Burdick, Kirby, and Tonawanda Creek Roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 12.8 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.9 feet on 01/08/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 700 AM EST.
